subject: Re: [junit] Weired problem using java.beans.XMLEncoder and junit
msgSnippet: ... First question before further investigation: have you tried the TextRunner?  If you re mentioning the excluded.properties problem, I bet you use the
messageBody:
> I have weired problem using java.beans.XMLDecoder in combination with
> the junit/runner/excluded.properties patch , which is necessary to
> avoid the "ClassNotFoundException"-problem with log4J.
>
> After patching excluded.properties the "ClassNotFoundException"-
> problem with log4J disapeared but instead i got a new problem in my
> own source. this problem only occured if i run my source with junit.
>
> (it does not occure, if i run it with eclipes junit runner or if i
> run the source from its main() without junit.)


First question before further investigation: have you tried the
TextRunner? If you're mentioning the "excluded.properties" problem, I
bet you use the SwingRunner and this runner is well know to have several
problems with the loading of classes. So first try to execute your
tests with the TextRunner.

I haven't had a look at the eclipse junit runner but it may be based on
the TextRunner and not the SwingRunner. If anyone can clarify this
point, I'd be thankfull (giving the cvs entry where I can have a look at
the implementation would be even better).

-Vladimir

--
Vladimir Bossicard
